sen.j: 玉水駅（たまみずえき）は、京都府綴喜郡井手町にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）奈良線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Ide-cho, Tsuzuki-gun of Kyoto Prefecture, Tamamizu Station is a stop on the Nara Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Tamamizu Station, located in Ide-cho, Tsuzuki-gun of Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Tamamizu Station, located in Ide-cho, Tsuzuki-gun of Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: プラットホーム形状と配置2面2線を有する行違い可能な地上駅。
sen.e: It is an above ground station with two platforms and double tracks at which trains can pass each other or pass others.
It is an above-ground station with two platforms and double tracks at which trains can pass each other or pass others.
It is an above-ground station with two platforms and double tracks at which trains can pass each other or pass others.

sen.j: 駅本屋側が1番ホーム、跨線橋を渡った反対側のホームが2番ホームである。
sen.e: Platform nearer the station building is Track #1 platform and the one opposite crossing a passengers' overpass is Track #2 platform.
The platform nearer the station building is the track No. 1 platform, and the one opposite crossing a passengers' overpass is the track No. 2 platform.
The platform nearer the station building is Platform 1, and the one opposite crossing a passengers' overpass is Platform 2.

sen.j: 上り線にあたる1番線が一線スルーのため、2番線は当駅で行違いを行う下り列車のみ入線する（2006年度のダイヤでの下り列車は、1番線発着と2番線発着が半々。
sen.e: As the inbound track or Track #1 is the thoroughfare, only outbound trains which pass each other or pass others at this station come in on Track #2 (the number of outbound trains departing from/arriving at Track #1 and Track #2 per fiscal 2006 timetable was the same.

Because the inbound track (track No. 1) is the thoroughfare, only outbound trains that pass each other or pass others at this station come in on track No. 2 (the number of outbound trains departing from/arriving at track nos. 1 and 2 per fiscal year 2006 timetable was the same).

Because the inbound platform (Platform 1) is the thoroughfare, only outbound trains that pass each other or pass others at this station come in on Platform 2 (the number of outbound trains departing from/arriving at Platform 1 and 2 per fiscal year 2006 timetable was the same).

sen.j: なお当駅は全列車停車のため、原則として上り列車が2番線に入ることはない）。
sen.e: Furthermore, as all trains stop at this station, inbound trains, in principle, do not come in on Track #2.
Furthermore, as all trains stop at this station, inbound trains, in principle, do not come in on track No. 2.
(Moreover, because all trains stop at this station, inbound trains, in principle, don't come in on Platform 2.)

sen.j: 駅業務はジェイアール西日本交通サービスへ委託されており、マルス (システム)端末の設備はない。
sen.e: Operations of the station are commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd. but a Multi Access seat Reservation System (MARS) terminal is not installed.
The operations of the station are commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd., but a Multi Access seat Reservation System (MARS) terminal is not installed.
The operations of the station are commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd., but a Multi Access seat Reservation System (MARS) terminal is not installed.

sen.j: 自動改札機は簡易式。
sen.e: Automated ticket gates are of simplified type.
Automated ticket gates are of the simplified type.
Automated ticket gates are of the simplified type.

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅であり、ICOCAの相互利用対象であるPiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）も利用可能。
sen.e: Both ICOCA and J Through Cards can be used as well as PiTaPa (Surutto Kansai Association) Cards which are subject ｔｏ mutual use with ICOCA Cards.
Both the ICOCA and J Through cards can be used as well as the PiTaPa (Surutto Kansai Association) cards, which are subject ｔｏ combined use with ICOCA cards.
Both the ICOCA and J-Thru cards can be used as well as the PiTaPa (Surutto KANSAI Association) cards, which are subject ｔｏ mutual use with ICOCA cards.

sen.j: 但しJスルーカードについては、簡易改札機による対応のため複数枚の処理不可。
sen.e: However, as ticket gates are of simplified type, more than one J Through Card cannot be processed.
sen.cmt: この記述は事実に反していますことを確認しました。
sen.e: However, as ticket gates are of the simplified type, more than one J Through Card cannot be processed.
However, the ticket gates are of the simplified type and can't process more than one J-Thru Card.

sen.j: 駅構内には、日本国有鉄道の鉄道の電化9000km達成記念碑（1984年建立）が立てられている。
sen.e: A monument (erected in 1984) commemorating Japanese National Railways electrifying 9,000km of its railway system stands within station premises.
A monument (erected in 1984) commemorating Japanese National Railways electrifying 9,000km of its railway system stands within the station premises.
A monument (erected in 1984) commemorating Japan National Railways electrifying 9,000 km of its railway system stands within the station premises.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization status
Usage status
Usage status

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約1,101人である。
sen.e: The nunber of passengers getting on at this station was approximately 1,101 per day in fiscal 2006.
sen.cmt: "約"は"平均"でないとつじつまが合わないと思います。
sen.e: The number of passengers getting on at this station was approximately 1,101 per day in fiscal 2006.
The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 1,101 per day in fiscal year 2006.

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）1月25日 - 奈良鉄道 桃山駅～玉水間延伸時に、その終着駅として開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated on Jan. 25, 1896 as the terminal station of the Nara Line when extended from Momoyama Ｓｔａｔｉｏｎ to this station.
It was inaugurated on Jan. 25, 1896 as the terminal station of the Nara Line when it was extended from Momoyama Ｓｔａｔｉｏｎ to this station.
January 25, 1896: The station was inaugurated as the terminal station of the Nara Line when it was extended from Momoyama Station to this station.

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）3月13日 - 当駅から木津駅まで路線延伸。
sen.e: Ｎａｒａ Ｌｉｎｅ ｆｕｒｔｈｅｒ extended from this station to Kizu Station on March 13, 1896.
sen.cmt: "路線延伸"の後に "工事完了"または"区間開通"等がつかないと、1日でそうなったかの表現です。
sen.e: The Ｎａｒａ Ｌｉｎｅ was ｆｕｒｔｈｅｒ extended from this station to Kizu Station on March 13, 1896.
March 13, 1896: The Nara Line was further extended from this station to Kizu Station.

sen.j: 途中駅となる。
sen.e: Became an intermediate station.
It became an intermediate station.
It became an intermediate station.

sen.j: 1905年（明治38年）2月7日 - 合併により関西鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Kansei Railway Company station on Feb. 7, 1905 as a result of amalgamation.
It became a Kansei Railway Company station on Feb. 7, 1905 as a result of amalgamation.
February 7, 1905: The station became a Kansai Railway Company station as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）10月1日 - 関西鉄道が鉄道国有法。
sen.e: Kansei Railway nationalized on Oct. 1, 1907 under the Railway Nationalization Act.
Kansei Railway was nationalized on Oct. 1, 1907 under the Railway Nationalization Act.
October 1, 1907: Kansai Railway Company was nationalized under the Railway Nationalization Act.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from split privatization of Japan National Railways.
It became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from the split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a JR West station due to the split privatization of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年）3月15日 - ダイヤ改正により、快速停車駅に格上げされる。
sen.e: The station upgraded to a rapid train stopping station on March 15, 2003 pursuant to timetable revision.
The station was upgraded to a rapid train stopping station on March 15, 2003 pursuant to the timetable revision.
March 15, 2003: The station was upgraded to a rapid train stopping station pursuant to the timetable revision.
